pullRequest.body:
We define (normalized) discrete valuations.

Co-authored-by: Filippo A. E. Nuccio <filippo.nuccio@univ-st-etienne.fr>

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

### PR summary [95ee7154a8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21371/commits/95ee7154a8bbf88db2bf5281b24cf7e23e8de37f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Valuation.Discrete.Basic` (new file)|993|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsDiscrete`
`+ IsDiscrete.surj`
`+ isDiscrete_iff_surjective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21370~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

```suggestion
`Multiplicative.ofAdd (-1 : ‚Ñ§)` belongs to the image of `v`.
```
I think it would also be good to say what `A` is here (and why this corresponds to the usual definition in the literature).

I'm not sure that `IsDiscrete` is a good name; the point is (as far as I can see) that the discrete valuation is *normalized*. The discreteness is captured by the target group already.

Also, `one_mem_range` looks a bit strange as a name of a property that talks about `Multiplicative.ofAdd (-1)`. (I know that it does correspond to `1` being in the image in the usual setting. Perhaps add a comment?)

```suggestion
  obtain ‚ü®œÄ, hœÄ‚ü© := hv
  refine WithZero.cases_on c ‚ü®0, map_zero _‚ü© fun a ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®œÄ ^ (-a.toAdd), ?_‚ü©
  simp [hœÄ, ‚Üê WithZero.ofAdd_zpow]
```
Using `WithOne.cases_on` here is defeq abuse (as `‚Ñ§‚Çò‚ÇÄ` is defined as `WithZero ...` and not `WithOne ...`)
Changing to `WithZero.cases_on` also gets rid of the ugly `rfl` at the end (which says that `WithZero.coe a = WithOne.coe a`).

```suggestion
  ‚ü®fun _ ‚Ü¶ IsDiscrete.surj v, fun hv ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®hv _‚ü©‚ü©
```
This is actually slightly faster.

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/Valuation/Discrete/Basic): define discrete valuations
